item.title: International Criminal Court rejects Rodrigo Duterte's bid for release from detention
item.description: Former Philippine President Rodrigo Duterte must remain behind bars while awaiting trial, judges at the ICC have ruled, saying he might use his freedom to interfere with the legal process and suggesting he was a flight risk.

item.title: Liberals find brief lull in internal hostilities for a passable week
item.description: If there was some internal call within the Liberals to show some discipline after the last few weeks, it worked at a basic level.

item.title: Donald Trump to impose new 100 per cent tariffs on China after Beijing restricts rare earths
item.description: The US President takes to Truth Social to say he sees "no reason" to meet Xi Jinping after Beijing's "hostile" move to restrict rare-earth exports.

item.title: Memories from the rubble
item.description: When 25-year-old Nour imagines herself back home in Gaza City, she remembers the things that made her smile. Now that's all gone.

item.title: Older borrowers taking out later-in-life loans risk post-retirement mortgage pain
item.description: Property analysts, brokers and banks report more borrowers are taking on big housing debts in their late 40s and 50s and, potentially, a retirement still saddled with mortgage repayments.

item.title: Japan's decorated trucks face 'extinction' but fans and truckies are trying to bring them back
item.description: The dekotora, large decorated trucks covered in colour and bright lights, were once a common sight across Japan. Now they are fighting for survival.

item.title: Queensland plan to extend life of coal-fired power stations sends 'mixed messages'
item.description: Communities across Queensland have welcomed plans to keep coal and gas burning across the state, though some warn a lack of future planning could undermine short-term benefits.

item.title: Donald Trump deserves credit for stopping the war on Gaza, but his key claim is overblown
item.description: In the tragic arc of the Israeli-Palestinian conflict, Donald Trump may have closed the latest — and most violent — chapter.

item.title: Queensland heating up with weekend thunderstorms forecast
item.description: The weather bureau says much of the state can expect above average temperatures with possibly severe thunderstorms in the south-east today.

item.title: Chaotic weather outlook raises prospects of summer bushfires across eastern states
item.description: An atmospheric "tug of war" for control of Australia's weather is taking place this spring, and it is a forecasting nightmare.

item.title: Timor-Leste workers part of PALM scheme helping to fill NT workforce gaps
item.description: The Northern Territory struggles to find workers for low- and semi-skilled jobs, but with increasing numbers of foreign workers arriving under the Pacific Australia Labour Mobility (PALM) scheme, that may be changing.

item.title: Alameddine crime network suspected in murder of UFC fighter Suman Mokhtarian
item.description: Police had intelligence that Sydney's Alameddine organised crime network wanted a former UFC fighter dead more than 18 months before his shooting murder this week.

item.title: AI-generated images of missing 4yo Gus raise legal concerns about misinformation
item.description: The thought of a missing boy lost in the outback is indescribably harrowing — but what's almost as disturbing is the realisation that some on social media have seized on the disappearance of four-year-old Gus as an opportunity to spread misinformation.

item.title: Alex de Minaur loses 6-4, 6-4 to Daniil Medvedev in Shanghai quarterfinals to miss out on career milestone
item.description: Alex de Minaur is eliminated from the Shanghai Masters, going down 6-4, 6-4 to former world number one Danil Medvedev in the quarterfinals, denying the 26-year-old Australian a chance of his 300th tour win.

item.title: Rockbank man charged with murder over the death of woman at Epping
item.description: A 50-year-old man faces court charged with murder after the death of a 44-year-old woman in Epping on Thursday night.

item.title: Concord Hospital's Ebola practice run-through tests department's emergency response plans
item.description: A high-stakes mission was undertaken at Concord Hospital this week — an exercise to test how multiple government agencies would react to any future infectious diseases outbreak.

item.title: Fashion's misogyny problem might end up in your wardrobe
item.description: Men sit at the top of the world's fashion houses while women designers get torn apart online.

item.title: Indigenous elder Alby Clarke remembered for ultramarathon and cycling feats
item.description: An Indigenous elder well-known for his sporting achievements, including using long-distance running and cycling to advocate for Aboriginal reconciliation and health, is remembered by loved ones.

item.title: Art courier Laurie Burgess grows his collection as he travels Australia delivering to galleries
item.description: Laurie Burgess has dedicated two decades to transporting artwork across the country, and has developed an appreciation and knowledge of the Australian art world few could rival.

item.title: Hotel owner mocks Wollongong Council's palm tree art after renovation refusal
item.description: A Wollongong hotel owner goes to unusual heights to mock a controversial piece of public art and protest against a council decision to knock back a development application.

item.title: Crispy pita bread, warm chickpeas and garlic yoghurt is an easy dinner - ABC News
item.description: This popular vegetarian Lebanese dish with crispy pita bread, warm chickpeas and a garlicky tahini yoghurt sauce is ready in 30 minutes.

item.title: Socceroos beat 2026 FIFA World Cup co-hosts Canada 1-0 with Nestory Irankunda scoring only goal in Montreal
item.description: Nestory Irankunda's late strike has given the Socceroos a 1-0 victory over FIFA 2026 World Cup co-hosts Canada in in Montreal.

item.title: Soccer the name of the game in Borroloola, even reigning over Australian Rules Football
item.description: Aussie Rules football is life for many in remote NT Aboriginal communities but in Borroloola, barefoot young women and girls dream of following their hero into soccer's A-League.

item.title: Mount Burr Swamp thriving after rehabilitation from farmland
item.description: The Mount Burr Swamp in South Australia is brimming with water, giving conservationists hope its success can be a blueprint for the future.

item.title: Machete brawl between groups spills into shopping centre in Melbourne's north
item.description: Investigators say a brawl between two groups armed with machetes spilled into a shopping centre in Broadmeadows on Friday night.

item.title: Kimberley woman part of Seven Sisters project makes submission to UN in fight for justice
item.description: It has been close to three decades since Irene Davey's daughter disappeared. Now she is taking her case to the United Nations in an attempt to finally get justice.

item.title: Only four people in Australia have been diagnosed with rare genetic disease CHOPS
item.description: Fourteen-year-old Isla Steed has unique challenges as one of just four people in Australia diagnosed with CHOPS syndrome.

item.title: Sydney FC's Amelia Cassar likened to Matildas World Cup heroes ahead of A-League Women season
item.description: At 17, Amelia Cassar is likened to some of Australia's World Cup heroes, as she embarks on her first season with the Sky Blues in the A-League Women competition.

item.title: Defunct NDIS provider given record $2.2 million penalty after Queensland man fatally hit by car
item.description: Proceedings began against the now-defunct provider following the death of a Queensland participant in 2023. The penalty is the highest civil sanction imposed on an NDIS provider to date.

item.title: National Rugby League award for Karratha Kangaroos named best community club
item.description: WA may traditionally be an AFL state but a club in the Pilbara has been named among the nation's best in another footy code.

item.title: 'Brilliant time capsule' of historical street images returns to Bendigo
item.description: A collection of photographs taken by an amateur photographer in a regional Victorian city in the 1950s, 60s and 70s has been returned.

item.title: Roaring jet boats to return to Victoria for first time in 15 years
item.description: From tractors to jet boats at Elmore, as Victoria prepares to host Australian series jet boat event in 2026.

item.title: Trump allies at odds as US moves forward with Qatari military training facility 'on the sacred soil of America'
item.description: The US military is moving forward with plans to build a dedicated facility in Idaho to train pilots from Qatar. But not everyone is happy.

item.title: Genomic medicine could be huge but 5 million Australians may miss out
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Genomic medicine researchers work to fix 'European bias' in DNA databases
item.description: Researchers are trying to fix the "Western bias" contained in many DNA databases with a new national project targeting multicultural communities.

item.title: North Melbourne closes in on remarkable winning record, Brisbane downs Port
item.description: The Kangaroos extend their extraordinary AFLW winning streak with a 36-point thumping of the Tigers, while the Lions stay in touching distance of the league's top four with victory over Port.

item.title: Hackers release Qantas customers' data on dark web
item.description: Hackers have released personal data from Qantas customers onto the dark web, following a cyber attack in July.

item.title: Former US President Joe Biden undergoing radiation therapy for cancer, spokesperson says
item.description: The spokesperson added the radiation treatment is expected to continue for five weeks and is a new stage in his level of care.

item.title: Trump's frustration with Modi over Russia ties misses the memo
item.description: Regardless of its historical defence ties to Russia, or its economic reliance on the United States, India is politically non-monogamous.

item.title: How did a mother and daughter at the centre of a suspected murder-suicide 'slip through the cracks'
item.description: The suspected murder-suicide of a mother and her daughter has raised serious questions about whether there were missed opportunities to intervene.

item.title: A new supermarket has been invited to Australia. Here's what that might mean
item.description: Last month, Prime Minister Anthony Albanese invited Emirati hypermarket chain LuLu Group to compete with Coles and Woolworths for market share. But some retail experts say entry into Australia's supermarket sector isn't so simple.

item.title: Albanese government's BetStop scheme not working, former gambler says
item.description: Diehard Richmond fan "Tiger Shaun" says he's watched on in horror as gambling advertising and sponsorships have come to dominate football — and become a constant reminder of the addiction he has struggled with.

item.title: Jared Kushner, Trump's son-in-law, was a key player in the Israel-Hamas peace deal
item.description: Jared Kushner was a familiar face sitting beside Israel’s PM as a first-phase peace agreement was finalised. According to senior US officials, it was because he was a key player in closing the deal.

item.title: Women express disappointment with some Chinese matchmaking platforms in Australia
item.description: Chinese Australian women are paying thousands of dollars to find love on matchmaking platforms in Australia, but behind the glossy promotions lies a different reality.

item.title: Platypus vanish from river where Charles Darwin pondered evolution
item.description: Almost 190 years on, in the place where Charles Darwin first spotted a platypus, the egg-laying mammal seems to have disappeared.

item.title: Cost blowout fears cloud $3.2b Women's and Children's Hospital
item.description: The Malinauskas government has become well-versed in the language of cost blowouts, and the $3.2 billion Women's and Children's Hospital is another chance for it to flex its vocabulary.

item.title: In one of Australia's fastest-shrinking regions, towns are fighting to remain
item.description: In the Yarriambiack Shire, 350 kilometres from Melbourne in Victoria's rural north-west, virtually all of the towns are shrinking.

item.title: Diane Keaton, star of Annie Hall, The Godfather films dies at 79
item.description: The unexpected news of Keaton's passing has been met with shock around the world, with stars remembering their time with the actor.

item.title: Koori Formal an incentive for Mid North Coast students to finish high school
item.description: The longest-running year 12 formal for First Nations people in New South Wales proves to be an incentive for students to complete their HSC.

item.title: Brandon Starcevich 'good to go' after trade to West Coast despite concussion concerns
item.description: West Coast recruit Brandon Starcevich says he has no concerns over his history of concussions after completing a trade to the Eagles from premier Brisbane.

item.title: Nick Offerman from Parks and Recreation stars as sovereign citizen Jerry Kane in new movie Sovereign
item.description: In Sovereign, Nick Offerman stars as real-life radical-right sovereign citizen Jerry Kane, who, with his son, killed two cops in Arkansas in 2010, drawing parallels to Australian fugitive Dezi Freeman.

item.title: Benjamin Netanyahu booed as Steve Witkoff speaks ahead of return of hostages
item.description: Thousands of Israelis have gathered in Hostages Square in Tel Aviv, where US envoy Steve Witkoff spoke to the crowd in anticipation of the release of the remaining hostages in Gaza.

item.title: Alyssa Healy backs Australia's batters to fire against India despite stuttering start to World Cup
item.description: Ahead of a crucial match against World Cup host India, Australia's captain Alyssa Healy says she has faith her side's top order can turn around its recent batting struggles.

item.title: Gregory Porter on turning personal pain into powerful music
item.description: From the pain of racism to the joy of love, Gregory Porter's voice carries it all with power and purpose.

item.title: Spring rains sow seeds of hope among Limestone Coast farmers after months of drought
item.description: After months of dust and dry skies, farmers on South Australia's Limestone Coast have welcomed early spring rain and a promising season ahead.

item.title: Three teenagers charged after alleged stabbing of father and son in Melbourne
item.description: The men were allegedly attacked on the Yarra Promenade overnight. Police arrested five teenagers and have charged three of them.

item.title: Mango the muster cat draws attention to western Queensland's ongoing recovery
item.description: Raised alongside working dogs, Mango isn't your average feline and comes complete with his own Facebook page, loyal followers and fan mail.

item.title: The NT has changed the way it responds to domestic violence. Here's what that means.
item.description: The NT has Australia's highest rates of domestic and family violence, with an intimate partner homicide rate seven times the national average.

item.title: Two arrested after Ian Watkins, disgraced former Lostprophets singer, killed in UK prison
item.description: British police have arrested two men on suspicion of murder after Ian Watkins, the disgraced former Welsh rock band Lostprophets singer who was serving a 35-year jail sentence for child sex offences, was killed in prison.

item.title: Indigenous community Bidyadanga hosts From the Desert to the Seaside music festival
item.description: From the Desert to the Seaside arts and music festival brings Western Australia's largest remote community of Bidyadanga together.

item.title: Roads in WA's East Pilbara need millions of dollars in repairs eight months after Cyclone Zelia
item.description: Australia's largest shire says it needs state and federal support to repair roads damaged during a cyclone, which provide a "lifeline" to remote communities.

item.title: Kelpies for Kids fundraiser at Perth Royal Show raises nearly $50k for sick children
item.description: A working dog auction at the Perth Royal Show raises nearly $50,000 for charity Telethon to support sick children.

item.title: From The Godfather to The First Wives Club — here are Diane Keaton's best films
item.description: With a career beginning in the late 1970s, Diane Keaton would star in more than 100 films and earn several Oscar nods.

item.title: Record beach patrols in South Australia this summer as life savers help battle algal bloom
item.description: A record number of beaches in SA are set to have Surf Life Saving patrols seven days a week this summer, as the state grapples with its toxic algal bloom.

item.title: Police search for man who disappeared during camping trip with wife in Victoria's east
item.description: Police are appealing to the public for help in locating a man who left to pick up supplies while camping with his wife in Gippsland.

item.title: At least 41 dead in Mexico's Veracruz region after landslides, floods
item.description: Authorities have attributed the deadly downpours to Tropical Storm Priscilla, formerly a hurricane, and Tropical Storm Raymond, both off the western coast of Mexico.

item.title: Afghan Taliban forces attack Pakistani border posts as 'retaliation' for Kabul air strikes
item.description: Afghan Taliban forces say they have captured Pakistani border posts, while Pakistani security officials say their military is responding "with full force" to the attack.

item.title: China accuses US of 'double standards' over new tariffs threat
item.description: Donald Trump says he will impose extra levies in response to what he called "extraordinarily aggressive" new Chinese export curbs on rare-earth minerals.

item.title: How long can you safely store and reheat leftovers?
item.description: Experts share their tips on how to best store cooked food to save money and avoid food waste.

item.title: Dockers stun Demons in 5-point AFLW upset, Swans snap losing streak, Saints down Magpies
item.description: Fremantle keeps its faint AFLW finals hopes alive with a five-point nail-biter against Melbourne, Sydney arrests a massive form slump against Carlton, while St Kilda notches its fifth consecutive win.

item.title: PM's XIII hammer Orchids 50-0 in Port Moresby
item.description: In their annual clash, the Prime Minister's XIII outclass the Orchids 50-0 in Port Moresby.

item.title: Thousands join pro-Palestinian rallies in towns and cities across Australia amid ceasefire
item.description: The rallies in cities and towns dubbed the Nationwide Rally for Palestine come less than a week after the second anniversary of the October 7 terrorist attack.

item.title: Australia could be left behind on renewables – 12 October 2025
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Australia's Diamonds defeat South Africa's Proteas 65-42 in third netball Test
item.description: Australia warms up for the eagerly anticipated Constellation Cup with a convincing 65-42 victory over South Africa in the third and final Test in Adelaide.

item.title: Ethan Strange stars as PM's XIII defeat Papua New Guinea 28-10
item.description: Ethan Strange underlines his case for Kangaroos selection and Trai Fuller scores four tries in the Prime Minister's XIII 28-10 defeat of Papua New Guinea.

item.title: Australia beats India by three wickets in Women's World Cup
item.description: Skipper Alyssa Healy scores a super ton and Ellyse Perry sees Australia home in a world-record women's ODI chase to beat India by three wickets in a World Cup thriller.

item.title: Government holds firm on not negotiating with hackers in wake of Qantas breach
item.description: The federal government is sticking to its position of not negotiating with cyber criminals, despite hackers releasing personal data from millions of Qantas customers onto the dark web and threatening to target Australia.

item.title: Vacherot becomes lowest-ranked ATP Masters winner after defeating his cousin Rinderknech in Shanghai
item.description: He beat his cousin Arthur Rinderknech 4-6, 6-3, 6-3 on Sunday local time to claim the first title of his career after a stunning run from the qualifying rounds.

item.title: Donald Trump accused of profiting from presidency as crypto ventures rake in hundreds of millions
item.description: Donald Trump's wealth has skyrocketed since his return to the White House nine months ago, leading to accusations that he is profiting from the presidency.

item.title: Australians join race for fusion energy as AI pressure on electricity sector starts to bite
item.description: The two great technology revolutions of the modern era — artificial intelligence and renewable energy — are colliding.

item.title: Western Sydney University consultants paid almost $3k a day, leaked documents show, as redundancies loom
item.description: As Western Sydney University prepares to shed hundreds of staff due to its dire finances, leaked documents reveal it is paying consultants as much as $2,850 a day.

item.title: Russia expresses 'extreme concern' over US providing Tomahawk missiles to Ukraine
item.description: Kyiv and the US are openly floating the idea of providing Ukraine with long-range Tomahawk missiles, in a move Russia says would mark "a very dramatic moment".

item.title: Uber drivers refusing rides due to guide dog, handler says
item.description: Sarah Maculans says she was refused rides by four Uber drivers within a week due to her guide dog, Sunny.

item.title: Israel 'ready to receive all of our hostages' from Gaza, Netanyahu's office says
item.description: The final 20 living Israeli hostages in Gaza are set to be released by Hamas in a matter of hours, with preparations by Israeli defence and medical authorities to receive the captives after more than two years hidden away from the world.

item.title: Koala killed by a car on Appin Road after being hailed a conservation success story
item.description: Koala deaths on Appin Road are not unusual this time of year, but the fatality of rescued koala Gage is cause for more than the usual frustration and despair.

item.title: Former tennis star Jelena Dokic grapples with complex grief after abusive father Damir's death
item.description: Jelena Dokic was abused by her father for years, with no tennis success enough to stop the beatings. She reveals the complex grief of losing a parent who showed no remorse.

item.title: Wetland ecosystem welcomed at Tasmanian sheep farm after 20-year restoration effort
item.description: A sheep farmer has welcomed the restoration of an internationally significant wetland on his property outside of Hobart. The collaboration of a non-profit organisation with landowners, scientists, the Aboriginal community and governments has allowed the return of a vital ecosystem.

item.title: Social media ban will further isolate regional and rural youth, LGBTIQA+ advocates say
item.description: LGBTIQA+ advocates are concerned the social media ban will have a significant impact on queer youth in regional and remote areas of Australia. They say there are not enough offline, physical supports for these teens to access when the ban comes into effect.

item.title: ASX closes down 0.8 per cent, gold hits new record, Treasury Wine Estates tumbles — as it happened
item.description: The ASX sheds 0.8 per cent following Wall Street's Friday hair-on-fire session while gold continues on its record breaking run.

item.title: Rebecca, the haunting story adapted into a Hitchcock classic, is now a gripping psychological stage play
item.description: First dismissed as "Gothic romance" when it was published by Daphne du Maurier in 1938, the haunting tale has evolved into a modern thriller about the expectations placed on women.

item.title: Isolated storms forecast for Queensland after weekend hail storm
item.description: The Bureau of Meteorology is also predicting a return to regular spring temperatures after a spell of warmer days.

item.title: Madagascar's President Andry Rajoelina says student protesters are attempting a coup
item.description: Troops from an elite unit of the country's military are urging fellow soldiers to disobey orders and back student protesters.

item.title: WA lawyers write to attorney-general calling for in-person court hearings to return to remote Balgo
item.description: With in-person court hearings suspended and video links cancelled, lawyers are struggling to ensure access to justice for the remote community of Balgo.

item.title: Climate Integrity says 'distorted research' behind government policy
item.description: Advocacy group Climate Integrity has accused the gas industry of using "distorted research", produced by the accounting firm EY, to influence the Australian government's Future Gas Strategy.

item.title: Brad Pettitt questions WA Labor's commitment to increasing Perth's tree canopy
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Fresh doubts over WA Labor election commitments to boost Perth’s tree canopy
item.description: The WA government is facing renewed questions over its plans to boost Perth's tree cover, with experts saying current funding will not come close to delivering on Labor's election promises.

item.title: AFL trade period, day six recap: Zach Merrett, Charlie Curnow and Christian Petracca remain in limbo seeking moves
item.description: Zach Merrett is one of a number of former All-Australians currently in limbo as West Coast continues to wheel and deal after another wooden spoon and Port Adelaide secures a midfielder.

item.title: Australia's Minjee Lee finishes third at LPGA Shanghai, behind winner Jeeno Thitikul
item.description: Thai world number one Jeeno Thitikul wins the LPGA Shanghai tournament on the fifth play-off hole, with Australian superstar Minjee Lee settling for third.

item.title: Committee formally recommends NT government adopt voluntary assisted dying
item.description: On the verandah of their Darwin home, Judy Dent held her husband's hand as he became the first person in the world to die through legally accessible voluntary assisted dying. That world-first would not be possible in the Northern Territory today.

item.title: Australian cricket captain Pat Cummins says he is 'probably unlikely' to play in first Ashes Test
item.description: Pat Cummins all but rules himself out of the first Ashes Test, saying he is still a way short of completing his condensed recovery schedule from a back injury.

item.title: Diane Keaton's death shocked many. US media says family kept her sudden decline private
item.description: The actor's cause of death has not been made public, but with US media reporting her family chose to keep her health decline private.

item.title: Teenagers charged after Hawthorn home owner detains alleged 15-year-old intruder
item.description: Police have charged two boys, aged 14 and 15, over two alleged early morning break-ins in Melbourne — one of which allegedly saw a man chase and restrain a teenager.

item.title: Fox Resources collapses, but fight against coal exploration in Bundaberg food bowl continues
item.description: Exploration company Fox Resources has gone into administration, but the community that successfully fought off its mining advances vows to keep fighting to cancel the tenement altogether.

item.title: World's biggest light installation to illuminate landscapes of Albany, WA
item.description: A light installation, projected onto King George Sound in Albany, will be the largest ever created.

item.title: Treasurer announces rework of stalled superannuation tax increase plan
item.description: The government has bowed to pressure on its superannuation tax policy, one of the few revenue-raising measures it had promised, two years on from when it was first announced.

item.title: Travel and dining vouchers on offer in SA's algal bloom summer plan
item.description: Some travellers to South Australia's coast over summer will be able to access $500 accommodation vouchers and $50 cashback on their meal, under a state and federal government plan to stimulate tourism.

item.title: Video games could fall under the social media ban, researchers say
item.description: Online video games are excluded from the social media ban, but digital media researchers say the definitions are too broadly defined and games could yet be included.

item.title: Eugowra flood inquest told official information was not accurate
item.description: A coronial inquest is told residents and emergency responders got inaccurate information from the Bureau of Meteorology (BOM) and Water NSW during a devastating flood that claimed two lives in the NSW town of Eugowra.

item.title: Teenager charged with torture, deprivation of liberty after alleged assault of 15-year-old boy at New Chum
item.description: The 17-year-old allegedly forced another boy into the boot of a car before assaulting him with a hammer and knife west of Brisbane.

item.title: Carter Gordon rushed back into Wallabies squad after quitting NRL's Titans
item.description: The Wallabies waste no time in welcoming back fly half Carter Gordon to rugby union, less than two hours after it was announced he was leaving the NRL.

item.title: How to tell if your Qantas personal data has hit the dark web and what you can do if it has
item.description: Hackers have released Qantas customer data onto the dark web. Here's what experts say to look out for if you think your personal data may be caught up in the leak and what actions you can take.

item.title: Pink Elephants report highlights care gaps for rural women experiencing miscarriages
item.description: Pregnancy loss is a lottery determined by location, according to a report that has sparked calls for the federal government improve care for women who experience miscarriage in regional and rural communities.

item.title: GrainCorp settles class action over noise and odour pollution in Numurkah
item.description: The class action was brought by a northern Victorian man who alleged that noise and odour pollution from a GrainCorp factory affected his health.

item.title: Peter Damjanovic pleads guilty to Tiffany Woodley's murder in Bedford home
item.description: Peter Damjanovic changes his plea at the last minute and pleads guilty to murdering his former partner Tiffany Woodley at her home in Bedford two years ago. WARNING: Indigenous readers are advised this story contains photos of someone who has died.

item.title: Patients of a Mortdale dentist practice urged to get tested for blood-borne viruses including HIV
item.description: Safuan Hasic, also known as Steven Hasic, has been barred from practising after breaching infection control standards at his Mortdale dentistry practice.

item.title: Victoria Police announces plan to slim down executive team, divert more officers to front line
item.description: Victoria Police will slim down its executive team and divert more officers to the front line under reforms aimed at reducing crime in the state.

item.title: What to do if your mortgage payments haven't gone down despite an RBA rate cut
item.description: You might assume home loan repayments will automatically reduce when an interest rate cut is passed on, but this isn’t always the case. Here's how to check.

item.title: Tasmanian MP Craig Garland temporarily disqualified from driving over drug driving charge
item.description: Independent MP Craig Garland applied in court for a restricted license, saying it would be a "terrible situation" if he wasn't able to attend parliamentary sitting weeks in Hobart due to the ban after being found guilty of drug driving.

item.title: Prince Andrew told Jeffrey Epstein 'we'll play some more soon' over email, UK media reports
item.description: Prince Andrew's relationship with convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein is back in the spotlight after UK media published an email between the pair over the weekend.

item.title: Police resume search for missing boy Gus in South Australia's outback
item.description: SA Police and ADF personnel will resume their search for missing four-year-old Gus in South Australia's mid-north tomorrow.

item.title: Here's how Labor's revised super proposal would work
item.description: Every prominent criticism of the tax has been addressed, with the result that it will apply to fewer people and raise less money.

item.title: Major review of medical scans at Caboolture Hospital to include 3,500 more patients
item.description: Thousands more patients have been caught up in a bungle involving medical scans not being reviewed by doctors at a major south-east Queensland hospital.

item.title: Pheobe Bishop accused Kieren Daniel Mittelheuser misses court due to medical episode
item.description: A medical episode has prevented Kieren Daniel Mittelheuser from appearing in court to face charges of accessory after the fact to murder.

item.title: Jesse Southwell signs with Broncos amid fears of lopsided NRLW competition
item.description: NSW State of Origin halfback Jesse Southwell's two-year deal with the Brisbane Broncos may add to the debate about the NRLW's competitiveness since it expanded to 12 teams.

item.title: Lidia Thorpe's 'burn down Parliament House' remark faces AFP probe
item.description: The Australian Federal Police has issued a rare statement confirming it is investigating whether independent senator Lidia Thorpe broke any laws by saying she was prepared to "burn down Parliament House" in support of Palestinians.

item.title: Jason Thomas King pleads not guilty to murdering landlord Susan Walker on the Gold Coast
item.description: Jason Thomas King is charged with 74-year-old Susan Walker's murder, and pleaded not guilty at the beginning of a Supreme Court trial in Brisbane on Monday.

item.title: Former teacher Rodney Neville Watkins guilty of sexually abusing boys in Perth
item.description: A former teacher is found guilty of sexually abusing primary school-aged boys in Perth, and one on Rottnest Island, in the 1970s in 1980s.

item.title: Hamas releases all remaining Israeli hostages in Gaza, IDF confirms
item.description: Israel says Hamas has handed over all 20 living hostages in the first phase of the Israel-Gaza ceasefire agreement.

item.title: Dolphin calf rescued after spending weeks tangled in fishing line
item.description: Marine rescuers issue an urgent plea for people to responsibly dispose of fishing gear after freeing a dolphin calf from a fishing line.

item.title: Australia's Diamonds mindful they need to lift against New Zealand's Silver Ferns in Constellation Cup
item.description: Despite the comfortable series win over South Africa, Australia is mindful it will need to step up a gear in the Constellation Cup against New Zealand.

item.title: Tatiana Dokhotaru told triple-0 her ex-partner was 'trying to kill' her before alleged murder, court hears
item.description: Danny Zayat has pleaded not guilty over the alleged murder of his former partner Tatiana Dokhotaru on May 26, 2023, in a high-rise complex in Sydney's south-west.

item.title: Court hears of 'irreparable damage' inflicted by former Canberra academic awaiting sentencing for rape
item.description: Prosecutors have called for the man to be jailed for a significant period of time after he was found guilty of raping two women by an ACT Supreme Court jury.

item.title: Woodside North West Shelf gas project extension challenged in Federal Court
item.description: Two separate appeals are launched in the Federal Court in a bid to overturn Environment Minister Murray Watt's approval of Woodside's gas hub extension on the North West Shelf.

item.title: SA Premier says algal bloom is not 'toxic', despite word appearing in official government advice
item.description: South Australia's Premier has questioned the use of the word "toxic" to describe the state's ongoing algal bloom, despite the word being used in government advice and by scientists researching it.

item.title: John Torney's mother gives evidence in his manslaughter committal hearing
item.description: John Torney's committal hearing begins as his mother tells the court she was the one who called police to check on the woman before her body was found.

item.title: Coronial inquest into death in custody of Dictor Dongrin begins
item.description: A coronial inquest has heard that a 29-year-old man was left for 21 hours without physical observation despite telling staff he had a history of suffering seizures while withdrawing from alcohol.

item.title: Who's in and who's out in Sussan Ley's new shadow cabinet
item.description: The changes follow two high-profile departures from shadow cabinet within a month.

item.title: Inside Victoria's escalating crime wave, where a car is reported stolen to insurers every 44 minutes
item.description: A rise in car theft and carjackings in this state has also seen parents left terrorised as cars are taken with their children inside.

item.title: Monday Finance for Alan Kohler
item.description: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

item.title: Money wiped from alleged vandals' bill over Bendigo artefact damage
item.description: Lawyers for a couple accused of vandalising significant artefacts say the damage caused by sprinkling vegetable oil was unintentional and part of a "blessing".

item.title: New testimony seeks to shed light on mysterious death of Mark Haines
item.description: An inquest has heard evidence contradicting the story told by a driver whose crashed car was found near the body of Mark Anthony Haines almost four decades ago.

item.title: Frustration mounts among Qantas customers as personal data released on dark web
item.description: The airline's customers voice their concerns and disappointment after cybercriminals release their personal data on the dark web.

item.title: Victoria is in the grip of a car theft crisis
item.description: Sarah Ferguson presents Australia's premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting public affairs journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus political analysis from Laura Tingle.

item.title: Government overhauls its proposed superannuation changes
item.description: Sarah Ferguson presents Australia's premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting public affairs journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus political analysis from Laura Tingle.

item.title: Family of hit and run victim call for justice
item.description: Sarah Ferguson presents Australia's premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting public affairs journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus political analysis from Laura Tingle.

item.title: Queensland council loses $2 million in alleged international fraud incident
item.description: Noosa Council alleges it was targeted by "international criminal gangs" in December last year.

item.title: Top stories from ABC News
item.description: Listen to ABC News interviews and commentary and analysis from radio programs like AM, PM and The World Today.

item.title: Trio win Nobel economics prize for work on innovation, growth and 'creative destruction'
item.description: Joel Mokyr, Philippe Aghion and Peter Howitt have won the 2025 Nobel economics prize for their work on how innovation and the forces of "creative destruction" can drive economic growth and lift living standards across the globe.

item.title: Jared Kushner's ties to the Middle East go far beyond diplomacy
item.description: The US president's son-in-law had little diplomatic or successful investment management experience before helping to broker the Gaza ceasefire deal.

item.title: Corporate watchdog slams superannuation funds on 'customer service', communications with retirees
item.description: ASIC's review of 12 super funds collectively responsible for more $1.2 trillion in member assets finds they are failing in customer service and communications, and may not be giving members information to make informed retirement decisions.

item.title: 'We have won': Trump hails ceasefire deal in address to Knesset
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Trump heralds 'new beginning' for Middle East
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: England provides the blueprint for 2029 Women's Rugby World Cup in Australia
item.description: The recently concluded Women's Rugby World Cup in England took the game to new heights. But, as Alicia Lucas writes, Australia needs to take big strides to ensure its hosting of the tournament in 2029 continues to raise the bar.

item.title: Australia's best surf lifesaving atheletes begin Iron Series with a re-imagined Gold Coast classic, Coolangatta Gold
item.description: The Coolangatta Gold may have been trimmed down, but the quality of the field sets up an exciting opening round of the 2025/26 Iron Series.

item.title: US and Arab countries sign deal throwing support behind Gaza ceasefire
item.description: The deal comes as one group representing hostages accuses Hamas of breaching aspects of the ceasefire agreement, with the remains of 24 hostages yet to be returned to Israel.

item.title: Modelling shows gas project emissions will cause hundreds of heat-related deaths
item.description: Fossil fuel companies and governments argue it's not possible to link climate impacts to specific projects, but Australian researchers have done the numbers.

item.title: Emotional reunions during hostage-prisoner exchange between Israel, Hamas
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Why Santos is behind your soaring electricity and mortgage costs
item.description: It was a primary force behind Australia’s inflationary surge, it’s forced businesses either to the wall or to shift offshore, undermined national industry policy and resulted in the loss of countless thousands of jobs. And it all hinged on one disastrous decision in an Adelaide boardroom.

item.title: Outback golf tournament brings together 150 players to support Royal Flying Doctor Service
item.description: There are no manicured greens in sight, but this golf tournament brings more than 150 players to an outback sheep station to raise funds for the Royal Flying Docor Service.

item.title: Advocates call for better measure of poverty, saying Australia's approach falls short
item.description: We get detailed measurements of population, participation and productivity. Advocates want to add a fourth "p" — poverty — so we can understand our economy.

item.title: Gaza updates live: Hamas returns some hostage bodies to Israel as Trump hails peace
item.description: Israel's military says Hamas has returned the bodies of four hostages from Gaza, with the remains of 24 others yet to be returned. Follow live.

item.title: The political theatre of Donald Trump's Middle East trip masks glaring questions about the peace plan
item.description: Donald Trump's unconventional and often haphazard approach to diplomacy means there are countless questions about what has driven him to date, and what might determine whether he stays engaged in the Middle East peace process in the future.

item.title: Technology dogs called in as search resumes for missing woman Lucinda Miller
item.description: Police have called in dogs capable of tracking electronic devices as they resume their search for Lucinda Miller, who disappeared three years ago after travelling to eastern Victoria.

item.title: Youth crime rates in the bush still high as leaders look for solutions
item.description: Official figures show youth crime is decreasing across NSW, but that does not ring true in some rural communities.

item.title: Cape Verde qualifies for 2026 FIFA World Cup in United States, Canada and Mexico
item.description: Cape Verde will play in the men's FIFA World Cup for the first time after beating Eswatini 3-0 to win its group in African qualifying for the 2026 showpiece.

item.title: Convoy carrying hostage bodies return to Israel
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Taskforce launched as search for Gus expands in SA's mid-north
item.description: As SA Police and the Australian Defence Force resume their search for missing four-year-old Gus in South Australia's arid mid-north, authorities have announced a new taskforce.

item.title: Man charged with arson over Glen Waverley and Mount Waverley sporting club fires
item.description: A man is charged with setting two community sports clubhouses on fire in Melbourne's south-east this year.

item.title: After 738 days, Israelis share mixed emotions as hostages are released from Gaza
item.description: Israelis gather to watch a historic day unfold as hostages held for two years are finally set free.

item.title: Federal politics live: Chalmers, Keating spoke 'half a dozen times' ahead of super U-turn
item.description: Treasurer Jim Chalmers confirms he spoke with former prime minister Paul Keating last week ahead of the government's U-turn on superannuation. Follow live.

item.title: Player holding Nazi flag in Roblox
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Roblox wants exemption from social media ban despite evidence of predators targeting children
item.description: Experts warn Roblox has a predator problem, amid reports Australian children are being exposed to a range of disturbing experiences on the platform.

item.title: NT government accused of 'turning a blind eye' to gas company's alleged environmental breach
item.description: A gas company operating in the Northern Territory has been accused of breaching environmental laws by an NT government department, which decided against prosecution in favour of a formal letter encouraging "behaviour change".

item.title: How to help kids prepare for music exams and competitions and manage performance anxiety
item.description: Music exams and competitions aren't easy, but our experts have some tips to make the process as stress-free as possible, including managing performance anxiety.

item.title: Markets live updates: ASX dips despite miners rising, Ansell reports cyber incident
item.description: Ansell is investigating a data breach, with some confidential or personal information accessed, as the ASX dips despite a rally in New York overnight. Follow the ABC News live markets blog.

item.title: Remote university access aimed at addressing workforce shortages in WA's Kimberley
item.description: Just 12 per cent of domestic students starting university in WA are from rural communities. It is hoped courses closer to home will address low participation rates and help overcome workforce shortages.

item.title: Chalmers wielded the axe on his super tax, but the PM's fingerprints were obvious
item.description: The treasurer has never been afraid to venture beyond his prime minister with his tax reform ambitions, but on superannuation, he has been pulled into line.

item.title: Fresh doubts over plans to boost Perth's tree canopy
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Six NRL players named in England rugby league Ashes sqaud, Man of Steel winner not selected
item.description: Six NRL players are in the England rugby league squad for the upcoming Ashes series against Australia, but there's no room for the most consistent player of the Super League season.

item.title: Trump 'deserves an enormous amount of credit' for peace deal: Richard Marles
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: AFL trade period, day seven live updates: Zach Merrett, Charlie Curnow and Christian Petracca deals racing the clock
item.description: Hawthorn's bid to add Essendon skipper Zach Merrett looks set to fall short, as the AFL trade period ticks towards Wednesday night's deadline. Follow live.

item.title: Generator trial to address mobile phone tower outages during WA emergencies
item.description: Rural communities battling power cuts to mobile towers during natural disasters are being offered a temporary solution with a trial of community-operated generators.

item.title: Alexei Popyrin defeated in ATP Tour Stockholm Open by American Sebastian Korda
item.description: Alexei Popyrin's ATP Tour return has ended with defeat as Australia's second-highest-ranked men's player returns following a back injury.

item.title: Linda Reynolds launches bankruptcy proceedings against Brittany Higgins after defamation win
item.description: Former senator Linda Reynolds files a creditor's petition in the Federal Court against her ex-staffer Brittany Higgins as she tries to recover damages awarded to her for defamation.

item.title: Midnight Oil fans rally to keep Rob Hirst's drum kit 'in public hands' at charity auction
item.description: Midnight Oil drummer Rob Hirst auctions off the kit, which he has had since 1979, saying he can no longer play it because of his battle with pancreatic cancer.

item.title: Plans for national art gallery in Alice Springs scrapped after government rift
item.description: The Northern Territory government scraps controversial plans to build the Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Art Gallery of Australia in Alice Springs, after nine years of back and forth.

item.title: Tougher jail sentences needed to address record crime in Victoria, police union says
item.description: The Police Association welcomes the Victorian chief commissioner's new strategy to get more officers on the streets, but says tougher sentences the only effective solution to crime crisis.

item.title: Search underway for bushwalker Daryl Fong in Tasmania's Mt Field National Park
item.description: A search is underway for a Tasmanian man in Mount Field National Park after his last contact on Sunday morning said he would seek shelter.

item.title: Fairview National Park bird "sound bath".
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Endangered powerful owl among 'sound bath' of bird calls captured by recordings
item.description: Powerful owls prey on possums, and even koalas, but local bird watchers are excited by the discovery of new pairs in South Australia.

item.title: Delays forecast for solar panels, batteries amid soaring demand, but advocates say gaps in access remain
item.description: The Queensland government unveiled its energy road map last week, introducing a new solar rebate scheme. The industry says similar subsidies mean demand is already surging.

item.title: Man arrested after alleged carjackings, dramatic pursuit in Melbourne CBD
item.description: A man is being assessed in hospital after a string of alleged carjackings beginning in Melbourne's west ended with his dramatic arrest in the CBD.

item.title: When to share the news of a pregnancy with your employer
item.description: Experts on the rules around when you need to inform your employer if you’re planning to take parental leave.

item.title: Madagascar's president flees country on French plane amid student protests
item.description: Andry Rajoelina flees the country amid widespread protests that saw an elite military unit join demonstrators in opposing the government.

item.title: Australia call up Josh Philippe and Matt Kuhnemann for ODI against India
item.description: Josh Philippe is set to play his first ODI for Australia in four years, after Josh Inglis failed to recover from his calf strain in time for the series opener against India.

item.title: Victorian Liberals to scrap statewide Treaty if elected
item.description: The Victorian Liberals will scrap the state's proposed Treaty agreement with First Peoples' if elected. The opposition had previously withdrawn support for the proposed agreement, which is set to be debated in Parliament today and is expected to pass with the support of Labor and the Greens.

item.title: Dave Hughes back in hospital with lung issues six weeks after AFL Legends match
item.description: Comedian Dave Hughes has returned to hospital, six weeks after suffering five broken ribs and a punctured lung in the AFL's Legends game.

item.title: Governments announce full details of $102.5m algal bloom summer plan
item.description: Large scale reef restoration, new real-time water monitoring and a $1 million trial of "AI-powered submersible cytobots" are part of a $102.5 million government algal bloom program to ensure "South Australians can enjoy their summer".

item.title: Hobart clinic offered government funding lifeline to stay open for six months
item.description: A southern Tasmanian private mental health clinic has been offered a six-month funding lifeline in the face of its impending closure.

item.title: Woman dies in house fire at Bellingen, west of Coffs Harbour
item.description: A 78-year-old woman has escaped the house fire that claimed the life of her daughter, who lived with disability.
